title: Reliance Jio Q3 Results: PAT jumps 26% YoY to Rs 6,861 crore; ARPU at Rs 203.3 - The Economic Times
Reliance Jio Q3 Results: PAT jumps 26% YoY to Rs 6,861 crore; ARPU at Rs 203.3 - The Economic Times
Reliance Industries Q3 Results: PAT rises 7% YoY to Rs 18,540 crore, revenue up 7% - The Economic Times
summary:
Reliance Industries Q3 Results: PAT rises 7% YoY to Rs 18,540 crore, revenue up 7%

Publication Date: Thursday
Source: Economic Times

Reliance Industries has reported a 7% year-on-year growth in its consolidated net profit for Q3, reaching Rs 18,540 crore, with revenues increasing similarly to Rs 2.43 lakh crore.

  • Profit exceeded estimates of Rs 18,337 crore.
  • Revenue exceeded expectations of Rs 2.39 lakh crore.
  • Operating profit (EBITDA) rose nearly 8% to Rs 48,003 crore.
  • Margins expanded by 10 basis points to 18%.
  • Jio Platforms net profit grew 26% YoY to Rs 6,861 crore.
  • Reliance Retail posted a revenue increase of 9% YoY to Rs 90,333 crore.
"It gives me great pleasure to see Reliance grow exponentially over the years and set new benchmarks that demonstrate the inherent strength and resilience we have across all our businesses." - Mukesh Ambani

The Q3 results reflect strong overall performance driven by key segments, leading to robust financial health amidst a challenging market.
newTitle: Reliance Industries Reports 7% Growth in Q3 Profit and Revenue

title: Gold surges ahead of US Retail Sales while yields have a long road to recovery - FXStreet
summary:
Gold Rallies Nearly 1% After Mixed Retail Sales Adds to Disinflationary Tailwind Fueling a Bullion Rally

Date: January 16, 2025 - Source: FXStreet

Gold's price (XAU/USD) is experiencing a rally following the release of mixed Retail Sales data and a disinflationary Consumer Price Index.

  • Gold price rallies, breaking further above $2,715.
  • Federal Reserve rate cut expectations flare up, fueling the Bullion rally.
  • Gold is on its way to the pivotal level at $2,721.
According to the CME FedWatch tool, the odds of interest rates being lower than current levels after the June meeting stand at 63.8%.

In conclusion, the outlook for gold remains positive as interest rate expectations shift, influenced by recent economic data.
newTitle: Gold Rallies Nearly 1% Amid Disinflationary Trends and Retail Sales Data

title: Havells Q3 Results | Net profit falls 3%; declares dividend, misses estimates - CNBCTV18
summary:
Havells Q3 Results | Net profit falls 3%; declares dividend, misses estimates

Date: January 16, 2024

Source: CNBC-TV18

Havells India Ltd reported a disappointing 3% drop in net profit for Q3, amidst increasing revenue but missing expected targets.

  • Net profit for Q3 fell to ₹278 crore, down from ₹287 crore YoY, against expectations of ₹344 crore.
  • Revenue from operations increased by 10.8% to ₹4,889 crore, but was below the predicted ₹4,991 crore.
  • EBITDA dipped 1.5% to ₹426.4 crore, missing the estimate of ₹494 crore.
  • The EBITDA margin decreased to 8.7% from 9.8% YoY.
  • The board declared an interim dividend of ₹4 per equity share, amounting to 400% on the equity share capital.
"The results came after the close of the market hours. Shares of Havells India Ltd ended at ₹1,557.30 up by ₹29.65, or 1.94%, on the BSE."

In conclusion, while Havells experienced revenue growth, the fall in profit margins and missed estimates raise concerns about future performance.
newTitle: Havells Q3 Results: Net Profit Falls 3% and Declares Dividend

title: Kia India upbeat on SUV Syros ahead of auto expo showcase - The Hindu
summary:
Kia India Launches New SUV Syros Ahead of Auto Expo

Date: January 16, 2025 05:59 pm IST | Source: The Hindu

Kia India has rolled out its latest SUV, Syros, from its Anantapur manufacturing facility. The vehicle has already received over 10,000 bookings and will be publicly showcased at the Bharat Mobility Global Expo starting January 17, 2025. Pricing will be announced on February 1.

  • Kia India rolled out the first customer unit of its newest SUV, Syros.
  • The SUV has garnered 10,258 bookings across various configurations.
  • Public show at Bharat Mobility Global Expo from January 17.
  • Pricing details to be revealed on February 1, followed by customer deliveries.
  • Syros is designed with advanced features specifically for the Indian market.
  • It includes 20 advanced safety features and up to 16 autonomous features.
  • Designed for urban and tech-savvy drivers.
“Just as we did with the Seltos, Sonet, Carens, we are excited to welcome a new wave of customers to the Kia brand...” - Ho Sung Song, President and CEO of Kia Corporation.

This launch positions Kia to redefine the Indian automotive market with innovative features and customer-focused design.
newTitle: Kia India Launches New SUV Syros Ahead of Auto Expo

BP Eliminates Thousands Of Jobs In Cost-Cutting Effort, CEO Says - Bloomberg
summary:
BP Eliminates Thousands Of Jobs In Cost-Cutting Effort, CEO Says

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Bloomberg

BP Plc is making significant layoffs, eliminating 4,700 positions from its workforce and more than 3,000 contractor jobs as part of its cost-reduction strategy.

  • 4,700 internal jobs cut, representing about 5% of BP's workforce.
  • More than 3,000 contractor positions will also be eliminated.
  • 30 projects have been paused to concentrate on more profitable ventures.
  • Digitization, particularly artificial intelligence, will play a crucial role in future efficiency plans.
“The company has stopped or paused 30 projects since last June to focus on the ones that make the most money,” said CEO Murray Auchincloss.

This decision reflects BP's strategic shift towards sustainable profits amid challenging market conditions.
newTitle: BP Cuts Thousands of Jobs as Part of Cost-Cutting Strategy

Gold gains as rate cut optimism revives after US CPI data - FXStreet
summary:
Gold Surges Ahead of US Retail Sales while Yields Have a Long Road to Recovery

Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: FXStreet

Gold prices are on the rise for the third consecutive day, breaking above the $2,700 mark amidst growing expectations of a potential Federal Reserve rate cut.

  • Gold price is currently above $2,700, reflecting a reversal from a previous weekly loss.
  • Investor optimism regarding a 25 bps rate cut by the Federal Reserve is supporting the bullish trend.
  • The next significant resistance level for gold is at $2,708.
“The odds of interest rates being lower than current levels after the June meeting stand at 63.8%.”

Upcoming data on Retail Sales and falling US Treasury yields indicate a shifting economic landscape, with potential implications for gold prices.

Infosys Q3 Results: Profit rises 11% to Rs 6,806 cr, revenue up 8% - The Economic Times
summary:
Infosys Q3 Results: Profit rises 11% YoY to Rs 6,806 cr, revenue up 8%

Publication Date: January 12, 2025
Source: ETMarkets.com

Infosys, India's second-largest IT services exporter, has reported an 11% year-on-year growth in consolidated net profit, amounting to Rs 6,806 crore, with operations revenue increasing by 8% to Rs 41,764 crore. The company has raised its revenue guidance for FY25 to 4.5%-5%.

  • Consolidated net profit increased by 11% YoY to Rs 6,806 crore.
  • Revenue from operations rose by 8% YoY to Rs 41,764 crore.
  • Revenue guidance for the fiscal year has been revised to 4.5%-5%.
  • Operating margins expected to be around 20-22% in FY25.
  • Operating profit grew 12% YoY to Rs 8,912 crore.
  • Infosys reported a large deal total contract value of $2.5 billion this quarter.
“Our strong revenue growth in a seasonally weak quarter and broad-based year on year growth reflects the success of our differentiated digital offerings,” said Salil Parekh, CEO and MD of Infosys.

In conclusion, Infosys demonstrated robust financial performance in Q3 FY25 with significant growth across key metrics, positioning itself strongly in the competitive IT landscape.
newTitle: Infosys Reports 11% Profit Growth in Q3 FY25

title: Infosys Q3 net profit beats estimate with 11% YoY jump; FY25 guidance raised - Moneycontrol
Infosys Q3 net profit beats estimate with 11% YoY jump; FY25 guidance raised - Moneycontrol
Axis Bank's net profit rises 4%; advances and deposits show slowest growth in 15 quarters - CNBCTV18
summary:
Axis Bank Reports 4% Rise in Net Profit Amid Slowest Growth in Advances and Deposits

Date: January 16, 2024 | Source: CNBC TV18

Axis Bank reported a 3.83% year-on-year increase in net profit, reaching ₹6,304 crore for the third quarter of FY24-25, slightly surpassing estimates.

  • Net profit rose to ₹6,304 crore, beating the ₹6,284 crore estimate.
  • Advances grew by 8.8% to ₹10.14 lakh crore; deposits increased by 9% to ₹10.95 lakh crore.
  • Net Interest Income (NII) was ₹13,606 crore, lower than the expected ₹13,677.3 crore.
  • Operating profit grew by 15% year-on-year to ₹10,534 crore.
  • Gross NPA ratio rose to 1.46%, and Net NPA increased to 0.35%.
"The quarter saw gross slippages of ₹5,432 crore compared to ₹3,715 crore in Q3 FY24."

Overall, while Axis Bank’s net profit increased, the growth in advances and deposits has shown signs of slowing, raising concerns about future performance.
newTitle: Axis Bank Reports 4% Rise in Net Profit Amid Slowest Growth in Advances and Deposits

title: Axis Bank Q3 Results: PAT jumps 4% YoY to Rs 6,304 crore, misses estimates - The Economic Times
Axis Bank Q3 results: Net profit rises 4% YoY to Rs 6,304 crore, misses estimates - Moneycontrol
summary:
Axis Bank Q3 Results: Net Profit Rises 4% Year-on-Year to Rs 6,304 Crore, Misses Estimates

Publication Date: January 16, 2025 / 17:15 IST

Private lender Axis Bank reported a 3.83% rise in its net profit to Rs 6,304 crore for the third quarter of fiscal year 2024-25. This increase, however, fell short of market estimates.

  • Net profit rose by 4% YoY despite missing expectations of 5.6% growth.
  • Interest income for the quarter was Rs 30,954 crore, up 11% from Rs 27,961 crore from the same period last year.
  • The lender's interest expenses increased by 12% to Rs 17,348 crore.
  • On a sequential basis, net profit declined by 9% compared to the previous quarter.
"Axis Bank's performance demonstrates growth, but the figures indicate challenges in meeting market estimations."

In conclusion, while Axis Bank shows a slight increase in profit, the numbers reveal challenges in sustaining higher growth rates in a competitive market.
newTitle: Axis Bank Q3 Results: Net Profit Rises 4% Year-on-Year to Rs 6,304 Crore, Misses Estimates

title: Waaree Renewable Technologies Q3 results FY2025 OUT: 17% YoY fall in net profit, interim dividend announced - ET Now
Warburg-owned Truhome Finance eyes ₹50,000 crore AUM in four years | Mint - Mint
summary:
Truhome Finance Aims for ₹50,000 Crore AUM in Four Years Under Warburg Pincus Ownership

Publication Date: Not specified, Source: Mint

Truhome Finance, previously known as Shriram Housing Finance, is poised to significantly grow its assets under management (AUM) to ₹50,000 crore in the next four years, targeting underserved markets in India.

  • The company aims to double its assets within three-and-a-half years.
  • Backed by Warburg Pincus, Truhome is focusing on affordable loans for a broader population.
  • Truhome Finance was renamed after Warburg acquired a controlling stake for ₹3,929 crore.
  • The rebranding and strategic shift seeks to capture a larger share of India's affordable housing market.
“We are doubling down on smaller, underserved markets,” stated a company representative.

This ambitious growth plan is aimed at enhancing accessibility to affordable housing loans across the country.
newTitle: Truhome Finance Aims for ₹50,000 Crore AUM in Four Years Under Warburg Pincus Ownership

title: Mahindra Destroys Tata’s Legacy In India? - MotorOctane
SBI share price jumps after announcement of Q3 results 2025 date | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
SBI Share Price Rises on Q3 Results Announcement Date

Publication Date: January 25, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

Shares of State Bank of India (SBI) increased by nearly 2% after the announcement of the date for its quarterly financial results.

  • SBI's Central Board will meet on February 6, 2025, to discuss financial results for Q4 2024.
  • The stock has gained 22.28% over the past year, outpacing both Nifty and Nifty Bank indices.
  • SBI's Q2FY25 net profit rose by 27.92% year-on-year, reaching ₹18,331 crore.
  • Net interest income grew by 5.37% year-on-year, totaling ₹41,620 crore.
  • Current deposit cost stands at 5.03%, an increase from previous quarters.
"The bank's Q2 results were better than expected, driven by non-interest income growth."

The increase in SBI's share price highlights investor confidence ahead of the upcoming results, signaling positive market sentiment.
newTitle: SBI Share Price Rises on Q3 Results Announcement Date

summary:
National Startup Day 2025: Top 10 Most Valuable Unicorns in India

Publication Date: January 16, 2025 | Source: CNBC-TV18

As India celebrates National Startup Day, this summary presents a look at the top 10 startups that are leading in valuations and showcasing innovation.

  • National Startup Day on January 16 recognizes startups that drive innovation and growth.
  • Top 10 unicorns include giants like Flipkart, PhonePe, and RazorPay.

  • These unicorns are recognized for leveraging technology and disruptive models.
“As India’s startup ecosystem continues to expand, it reflects the vital role these ventures play in shaping the future of the country’s economy.”

title: 'Kitne ghazi aaye, kitne ghazi gaye': Adani CFO after Hindenburg shutdown - Business Standard
Reliance Industries Q3 FY25 results preview: Net profit seen up 6%, margin expansion expected - Moneycontrol
summary:
Reliance Industries Q3 FY25 results preview: Net profit seen up 6%, margin expansion expected

Date: January 16, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Reliance Industries is set to post a 6% sequential growth in Q3 net profit to Rs 17,482 crore, driven by stronger refining margins and higher ARPU in digital services.

  • Expected Q3 net profit of Rs 17,482 crore.
  • Estimated EBITDA of Rs 41,125 crore, reflecting a 5% quarter-on-quarter growth.
  • Improvement in EBITDA margin estimated between 18.2% and 18.9%.
  • Mixed performance anticipated, with strong telecom earnings and refining margins offsetting weaknesses in petrochemicals.
“RIL’s Q3 results are expected to be supported by robust growth in telecom and refining margins, despite challenges in the retail sector.”

Overall, RIL's Q3 FY25 results are expected to reflect strong earnings growth amidst a challenging market environment.
newTitle: Reliance Industries Q3 FY25 Results Preview: Net Profit Expected to Grow

title: IRFC, RVNL, Ircon, other railway stocks surge as govt may increase rail budget by 18% in FY26 - Moneycontrol
summary:
IRFC, RVNL, Ircon, other railway stocks surge as govt may increase rail budget by 18% in FY26

Date: January 16, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Railway stocks have rebounded strongly in response to reports of a potential significant increase in the railway budget for FY26, leading to improved investor sentiment.

  • Government may increase the rail budget allocation by 15-18% for FY26.
  • Expected allocation of Rs 2.9-3 lakh crore for gross budgetary support for Indian Railways.
  • Focus on enhancing railway infrastructure and production of Vande Bharat trains.
  • IRFC shares surged 11.45% while RVNL and Railtel Corporation gained 11.66% and 8.77% respectively.
“The anticipated increase has boosted investor sentiment, reversing the downward trend seen in recent months.”

This expected budget increase indicates strong governmental support for rail infrastructure development, promising positive growth in the sector.
newTitle: Railway Stocks Surge as Government Plans 18% Budget Increase
